abe <Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com <mailto:Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com> >
Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Dear Sonia and team,

 

Are these all the documents? There are some major discrepancies and inconsistencies. Few comments from my side as a result of a high level review:

 

*	Amount different from USD 4.440K
*	General conditions do not align with the Orgalime contract draft (for example payment, late payment terms, Securities, Compensation, termination fees and lots more). It seems that the General Conditions document is a generic document and has not been modified to fit the purpose of this deal.
*	I have added some comments to the Orgalime contract (word document).
*	There are some key terms missing including (but not limited to) invoicing, shipping, good vs services, payment links (to invoicing or to shipping/provision of services), payment location (UAE/KSA).
*	Tax clauses are missing.

 

I suggest thorough review of these documents as well as having one contract/agreement properly drafted (and reviewed by tax) addressing all key aspects of this deal to ensure we are properly protected. Overall, the current drafts are inadequate, and it is strongly recommended that they are re-drafted/amended to fit the purpose.

 

Kind regards,

abe <Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com <mailto:Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com> >
Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Dear All,

 

I have had few discussions with AlTayer head of indirect tax (Jesus) and clarified the process. Here is a summary. Let me know if any questions:

 

*	Swisslog PE in KSA has neither a Commercial Registration nor an Import license in KSA. Therefore, the import clearance formalities of the equipment are carried out by their customers in KSA. This is the practice adopted for all the projects carried out by the PE in the KSA .

 

*	For the imports of goods, Swisslog will be issuing a Customs invoice from the UAE. This invoice will be used to clear the goods. No VAT / Customs implications should arise - Paragraph 4.3 of the ZATCA Resolution regarding ILBZ tax regime, SILZ is an area with a suspension status of customs duties and restrictions. Consequently, goods entering the zone are subject to special customs controls and procedures. The suspension of Customs duties payment extends to VAT in accordance with the VAT provisions and legislation in force (subject to ZATCA’s response to our ruling).  This would imply that goods of foreign origin from outside KSA may enter the zone without being subject to customs duties, VAT and restrictions if they are related to the activities licensed to be practiced in the zone.

 

*	When the project milestones are achieved, a Tax Invoice will be raised from the KSA PE with VAT at 15%.

 

*	The down payment invoice (which will be a Tax invoice with VAT) will be set off against milestones invoices and not import invoices.

Subject: Re: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Hello,

Both SASO and ZATCA have yet to provide clear instructions on how these imports can be cleared, especially since CR issued by GACA does not authorize us to open an account with ZATCA or SABER, besides, we need a confirmation on whether items intended for warehouse operations are exempt from VAT, customs duties, and SASO requirements or not, following our last meeting with GACA, they clarified that VAT and customs exemptions for operational imports can only be requested after obtaining the completion certificate for the construction phase, maybe SILZ can provide a definitive answer to this matter.

Swisslog must confirm whether the shipment invoice will indicate 0% or 15% VAT. So far, they have provided only the advanced payment invoice, which cannot be used for shipment clearance, we also require detailed information about the items, including their description, HS codes and country of origin, to consult ZATCA and SASO for further clarification.

Regards,,

 

AHMAD HUSSEIN​​​​

‑

احمد حسين

DIRECTOR ‑ PRODUCT COMPLIANCE

CHALHOUB GROUP ARABIA LIMITED COMPANY LLC

You are correct; this aligns with what we agreed upon today. However, please note that Swisslog does not have a legal entity in Saudi Arabia; they only have a Permanent Establishment (P.E.). As per the agreement, we will be the ones responsible for clearing the shipment.

George Akkawi <george.akkawi@swisslog.com <mailto:george.akkawi@swisslog.com> >
Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/-

 

Hi Shaik & Zaher,

 

Greetings from Swisslog.

 

Please find below the explanation from our finance team :

 

1.	Project attributable to the Permanent Establishment (PE) in KSA of SwissLog Middle East LLC

 

*       The PE Swisslog Middle East LLC in KSA is registered for VAT purposes as it probes the attached VAT certificate.

*       This project is attributable to the PE of this entity in KSA as the entity is established in KSA and there is a “force of attraction” for VAT purposes in KSA as this PE is the responsible one in executing this project.   

*       Therefore, the transaction is subject to VAT in KSA and Swisslog Middle East LLC ‘s PE should be obliged to charge 15 % VAT on the transactions.  

*       The above-mentioned VAT treatment would not be affected by the fact that the KSA customer is an entity established at the ILBZ Free zone as If a mainland entity sells capital goods to an entity in the ILBZ, the usual VAT rules will apply to such transactions as the special tax regime applicable to transactions carried out by entities established in the ILBZ is not applicable.

 

2.	Application of an Alternative scenario

 

*       In case, if the project has to be invoiced from the entity’s UAE tax ID number.  

*       as the project is attributable to its PE in KSA, Swisslog Middle East LLC should not be in position to use its UAE tax registration for invoicing the project.

*       as the project is attributable to its PE in KSA, Swisslog Middle East LLC should not be in position to use its UAE tax registration for invoicing the project.

*       As a result of it, in the hypothetical case that the entity raised tax invoices from its UAE tax ID, the KSA VAT Authorities could consider that because of the force of attraction rule, the transactions of these projects should be subject to VAT in the KSA.

*       In addition, the KSA tax authorities could consider that any income arising from this project would be subject for direct tax purposes in KSA and 5% withholding tax should be applicable to any technical services component derived from this project.   

 

3.	Conclusions and way forward

 

The main conclusion is that as the project is attributable to SwissLog Middle East LLC PE in KSA, the tax invoice already raised by the entity to its KSA customer established in the ILBZ  where 15% KSA VAT has been applicable is correct from a KSA VAT standpoint.  

 

I believe this explains the situation but if you still have any questions, we can arrange the call with our tax expert when he is back next week. Please let us know your availability.

 

Best Regards,

Dear Sourabh ,

Technical points :

 

1.	As discussed ,appreciate to share the warranty document and the scope detail covered by the warranty. warranty is provided against manufacturing defect or poor workmanship as per Orgalime contract.

The spare parts package on site ensures the downtime is kept the lowest and provides increased system availability.

 

 

3.	Pick Stations – Pick to Light & Put to Light should be an integrated solution as the Pick Stations need to be configurable between Mono-Order-Picking and Multi-Order-Picking . kindly add the cost of put to light for the 8 Outbound stations .

Our assumption is that pick to light is already part of your scope , please confirm whether put to light stands along with light and controllers are included in your offer if not please share the cost.

*       Pick by light (Pointer) for 8 workstations

      These were shown as optional value-added features in all our earlier offers and presentations.

 

4.	Cockpit – We need to have the Analytics Cockpit as part of the offer for visibility of operational stats real time for better managing the operations. kindly share the cost. Added the offer for Cockpit in the attached document.

Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Dear Mariel,

 

Would the following clause be sufficient?

 

All amounts payable under this Contract, including Contract Price, are exclusive of any applicable Taxes. Each Party shall be responsible for its own applicable Taxes and similar charges (including any related interest and penalties) as per the relevant tax laws and regulations. For the purpose of this clause, "Taxes" means all forms of taxation (including Zakat) and statutory and governmental, state, provincial, local governmental or municipal charges, duties, contributions, levies, withholdings and deductions, whether direct or indirect and whether levied by reference to income, profits, gains, net wealth, asset values, turnover, added value or other reference, and statutory, governmental, state, provincial, local governmental or municipal impositions, duties, contributions, rates and levies (including social security contributions and any other payroll taxes) or fees payable to any authority (including the Zakat, Tax and Customs Authority of the KSA), and value added tax or any other sales taxes, whenever and wherever charged and/or imposed (whether imposed by way of a withholding or deduction for or on account of tax or otherwise) and in respect of any person, and all penalties, charges, costs and interest relating thereto.

 

For reference, the T&C defines the "Contract Price" as "the total amount to be paid by the Purchaser for the Works, excluding value added tax and all other taxes or duties levied in the country where the Site is located".

Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Dear Sonia and team,

 

Are these all the documents? There are some major discrepancies and inconsistencies. Few comments from my side as a result of a high level review:

 

*	Amount different from USD 4.440K
*	General conditions do not align with the Orgalime contract draft (for example payment, late payment terms, Securities, Compensation, termination fees and lots more). It seems that the General Conditions document is a generic document and has not been modified to fit the purpose of this deal.
*	I have added some comments to the Orgalime contract (word document).
*	There are some key terms missing including (but not limited to) invoicing, shipping, good vs services, payment links (to invoicing or to shipping/provision of services), payment location (UAE/KSA).
*	Tax clauses are missing.

 

I suggest thorough review of these documents as well as having one contract/agreement properly drafted (and reviewed by tax) addressing all key aspects of this deal to ensure we are properly protected. Overall, the current drafts are inadequate, and it is strongly recommended that they are re-drafted/amended to fit the purpose.

 

Kind regards,

abe <Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com <mailto:Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com> >
Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Dear All,

 

I have had few discussions with AlTayer head of indirect tax (Jesus) and clarified the process. Here is a summary. Let me know if any questions:

 

*	Swisslog PE in KSA has neither a Commercial Registration nor an Import license in KSA. Therefore, the import clearance formalities of the equipment are carried out by their customers in KSA. This is the practice adopted for all the projects carried out by the PE in the KSA .

 

*	For the imports of goods, Swisslog will be issuing a Customs invoice from the UAE. This invoice will be used to clear the goods. No VAT / Customs implications should arise - Paragraph 4.3 of the ZATCA Resolution regarding ILBZ tax regime, SILZ is an area with a suspension status of customs duties and restrictions. Consequently, goods entering the zone are subject to special customs controls and procedures. The suspension of Customs duties payment extends to VAT in accordance with the VAT provisions and legislation in force (subject to ZATCA’s response to our ruling).  This would imply that goods of foreign origin from outside KSA may enter the zone without being subject to customs duties, VAT and restrictions if they are related to the activities licensed to be practiced in the zone.

 

*	When the project milestones are achieved, a Tax Invoice will be raised from the KSA PE with VAT at 15%.

 

*	The down payment invoice (which will be a Tax invoice with VAT) will be set off against milestones invoices and not import invoices.

Kind regards,

Subject: Re: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Hello,

Both SASO and ZATCA have yet to provide clear instructions on how these imports can be cleared, especially since CR issued by GACA does not authorize us to open an account with ZATCA or SABER, besides, we need a confirmation on whether items intended for warehouse operations are exempt from VAT, customs duties, and SASO requirements or not, following our last meeting with GACA, they clarified that VAT and customs exemptions for operational imports can only be requested after obtaining the completion certificate for the construction phase, maybe SILZ can provide a definitive answer to this matter.

Swisslog must confirm whether the shipment invoice will indicate 0% or 15% VAT. So far, they have provided only the advanced payment invoice, which cannot be used for shipment clearance, we also require detailed information about the items, including their description, HS codes and country of origin, to consult ZATCA and SASO for further clarification.

Regards,,

 

AHMAD HUSSEIN​​​​

‑

احمد حسين

George Akkawi <george.akkawi@swisslog.com <mailto:george.akkawi@swisslog.com> >
Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/-

 

Hi Shaik & Zaher,

 

Greetings from Swisslog.

 

Please find below the explanation from our finance team :

 

1.	Project attributable to the Permanent Establishment (PE) in KSA of SwissLog Middle East LLC

 

*       The PE Swisslog Middle East LLC in KSA is registered for VAT purposes as it probes the attached VAT certificate.

*       This project is attributable to the PE of this entity in KSA as the entity is established in KSA and there is a “force of attraction” for VAT purposes in KSA as this PE is the responsible one in executing this project.   

*       Therefore, the transaction is subject to VAT in KSA and Swisslog Middle East LLC ‘s PE should be obliged to charge 15 % VAT on the transactions.  

*       The above-mentioned VAT treatment would not be affected by the fact that the KSA customer is an entity established at the ILBZ Free zone as If a mainland entity sells capital goods to an entity in the ILBZ, the usual VAT rules will apply to such transactions as the special tax regime applicable to transactions carried out by entities established in the ILBZ is not applicable.

 

2.	Application of an Alternative scenario

 

*       In case, if the project has to be invoiced from the entity’s UAE tax ID number.  

*       as the project is attributable to its PE in KSA, Swisslog Middle East LLC should not be in position to use its UAE tax registration for invoicing the project.

chunks.text:
*       as the project is attributable to its PE in KSA, Swisslog Middle East LLC should not be in position to use its UAE tax registration for invoicing the project.

*       As a result of it, in the hypothetical case that the entity raised tax invoices from its UAE tax ID, the KSA VAT Authorities could consider that because of the force of attraction rule, the transactions of these projects should be subject to VAT in the KSA.

*       In addition, the KSA tax authorities could consider that any income arising from this project would be subject for direct tax purposes in KSA and 5% withholding tax should be applicable to any technical services component derived from this project.   

 

3.	Conclusions and way forward

 

The main conclusion is that as the project is attributable to SwissLog Middle East LLC PE in KSA, the tax invoice already raised by the entity to its KSA customer established in the ILBZ  where 15% KSA VAT has been applicable is correct from a KSA VAT standpoint.  

 

I believe this explains the situation but if you still have any questions, we can arrange the call with our tax expert when he is back next week. Please let us know your availability.

 

Best Regards,

Sourabh Shaha

Sales Manager – Middle East

Dear Rami and Sourabh, 

 

Thank you for submitting your Proposal for the warehouse automation project. We received several compelling offers, and we genuinely appreciate the effort and the time you have invested in your proposal. 

I am writing to officially announce that your company has been awarded the tender for this project. We evaluated all proposals according to the selection criteria outlined in the tender document. Your submission matched the requirements, and we were impressed by the quality of your proposal. 

We look forward to working with your team in delivering this project. We recognize the importance of developing a strong partnership with our suppliers, and we are confident that we can cooperate in achieving a successful outcome. 

 

About next steps. 

 

*         Please fill and sign the attached LOI .

 

*         We will initiate the PO issuance process.  

 

*         For the contract: we would need to engage in a formal agreement. If you have a contract template, please provide a copy for our Legal review.

 

My colleague @Reuben Thomas <mailto:Reuben.Thomas@chalhoub.com>  will support in the legal discussions .

 

And Once again, thank you for your interest in our project and for providing a compelling proposal.

Dear Sourabh ,

 

Hope all is good at your end !

I would like to thank you for submitting the revised offer . After internal review , I am sharing with you list of comments to be reviewed and considered in your offer :

 

Technical points :

 

1.	As discussed ,appreciate to share the warranty document and the scope detail covered by the warranty. warranty is provided against manufacturing defect or poor workmanship as per Orgalime contract.

warranty is provided against manufacturing defect or poor workmanship as per Orgalime contract. It does not cover the misuse of the system or accidents caused due to the client’s usage.

 

2.	Kindly confirm that during the warranty period, any spares used for fixing the issues by Swisslog needs to be replenished free of cost or replaced in case is used from our stock. Please define the replenishment SLA. During warranty period, any spares used by Swisslog will be replenished Free of cost. The spare parts package on site ensures the downtime is kept the lowest and provides increased system availability.

 

 

3.	Pick Stations – Pick to Light & Put to Light should be an integrated solution as the Pick Stations need to be configurable between Mono-Order-Picking and Multi-Order-Picking . kindly add the cost of put to light for the 8 Outbound stations .

Our assumption is that pick to light is already part of your scope , please confirm whether put to light stands along with light and controllers are included in your offer if not please share the cost.

Please refer the attached updated offer for :

*       Pick by light (Pointer) for 8 workstations

*       Pick/put to light systems for 8 picking workstations (The manual trolleys to be provided by Chalhoub)

      

      These were shown as optional value-added features in all our earlier offers and presentations.

 

4.	Cockpit – We need to have the Analytics Cockpit as part of the offer for visibility of operational stats real time for better managing the operations. kindly share the cost. Added the offer for Cockpit in the attached document.

6.	Testing & UAT – We will need a separate instance for integration testing & UAT, other than production environment along with a simulator to replicate the behavior of the Decanting & Picking activities for testing. kindly confirm it is part of the scope.

We will provide a test and live environments. Testing can be performed in test environment, and it can be moved to live once the testing is satisfactory.

We have included ramp up support after Taking Over (1 week on-site and 2 weeks remote support)

Dear Sayed,

 

I would suggest the following amended wording:

 

Where “Taxes” means all forms of taxation and statutory and governmental, state, provincial, local governmental or municipal charges, duties, contributions, levies, withholdings and deductions, whether direct or indirect, and whether levied by reference to income, profits, gains, net wealth, asset values, turnover, added value or other reference, and statutory, governmental, state, local governmental or municipal impositions, duties, contributions, rates and levies or fees payable to any authority (including a tax authority), and value added tax or any other sales taxes, whenever and wherever charged and/or imposed (whether imposed by way of a withholding or deduction for or on account of tax or otherwise) and in respect of any person, and all penalties, charges, costs and interest relating thereto; 

 

Each party shall be responsible for its own tax obligations and liabilities arising from the execution of this agreement. The parties shall take all necessary steps to comply with local tax laws, including the filing of tax returns and payment of taxes. Each Party shall bear all taxes imposed on it by law in connection with this Agreement. 

 

In the event that local tax regulations require the withholding of taxes on payments made under this agreement, the paying party shall withhold the required amount and remit it to the relevant tax authorities.

Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Dear Mariel,

 

Would the following clause be sufficient?

 

All amounts payable under this Contract, including Contract Price, are exclusive of any applicable Taxes. Each Party shall be responsible for its own applicable Taxes and similar charges (including any related interest and penalties) as per the relevant tax laws and regulations. For the purpose of this clause, "Taxes" means all forms of taxation (including Zakat) and statutory and governmental, state, provincial, local governmental or municipal charges, duties, contributions, levies, withholdings and deductions, whether direct or indirect and whether levied by reference to income, profits, gains, net wealth, asset values, turnover, added value or other reference, and statutory, governmental, state, provincial, local governmental or municipal impositions, duties, contributions, rates and levies (including social security contributions and any other payroll taxes) or fees payable to any authority (including the Zakat, Tax and Customs Authority of the KSA), and value added tax or any other sales taxes, whenever and wherever charged and/or imposed (whether imposed by way of a withholding or deduction for or on account of tax or otherwise) and in respect of any person, and all penalties, charges, costs and interest relating thereto.

 

For reference, the T&C defines the "Contract Price" as "the total amount to be paid by the Purchaser for the Works, excluding value added tax and all other taxes or duties levied in the country where the Site is located".

Dear Sonia and team,

 

Are these all the documents? There are some major discrepancies and inconsistencies. Few comments from my side as a result of a high level review:

 

*	Amount different from USD 4.440K
*	General conditions do not align with the Orgalime contract draft (for example payment, late payment terms, Securities, Compensation, termination fees and lots more). It seems that the General Conditions document is a generic document and has not been modified to fit the purpose of this deal.
*	I have added some comments to the Orgalime contract (word document).
*	There are some key terms missing including (but not limited to) invoicing, shipping, good vs services, payment links (to invoicing or to shipping/provision of services), payment location (UAE/KSA).
*	Tax clauses are missing.

 

I suggest thorough review of these documents as well as having one contract/agreement properly drafted (and reviewed by tax) addressing all key aspects of this deal to ensure we are properly protected. Overall, the current drafts are inadequate, and it is strongly recommended that they are re-drafted/amended to fit the purpose.

 

Kind regards,

abe <Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com <mailto:Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com> >
Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Dear All,

 

I have had few discussions with AlTayer head of indirect tax (Jesus) and clarified the process. Here is a summary. Let me know if any questions:

 

*	Swisslog PE in KSA has neither a Commercial Registration nor an Import license in KSA. Therefore, the import clearance formalities of the equipment are carried out by their customers in KSA. This is the practice adopted for all the projects carried out by the PE in the KSA .

 

*	For the imports of goods, Swisslog will be issuing a Customs invoice from the UAE. This invoice will be used to clear the goods. No VAT / Customs implications should arise - Paragraph 4.3 of the ZATCA Resolution regarding ILBZ tax regime, SILZ is an area with a suspension status of customs duties and restrictions. Consequently, goods entering the zone are subject to special customs controls and procedures. The suspension of Customs duties payment extends to VAT in accordance with the VAT provisions and legislation in force (subject to ZATCA’s response to our ruling).  This would imply that goods of foreign origin from outside KSA may enter the zone without being subject to customs duties, VAT and restrictions if they are related to the activities licensed to be practiced in the zone.

 

*	When the project milestones are achieved, a Tax Invoice will be raised from the KSA PE with VAT at 15%.

 

*	The down payment invoice (which will be a Tax invoice with VAT) will be set off against milestones invoices and not import invoices.

Kind regards,

abe <Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com <mailto:Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com> >
Subject: Re: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Hello,

Both SASO and ZATCA have yet to provide clear instructions on how these imports can be cleared, especially since CR issued by GACA does not authorize us to open an account with ZATCA or SABER, besides, we need a confirmation on whether items intended for warehouse operations are exempt from VAT, customs duties, and SASO requirements or not, following our last meeting with GACA, they clarified that VAT and customs exemptions for operational imports can only be requested after obtaining the completion certificate for the construction phase, maybe SILZ can provide a definitive answer to this matter.

Swisslog must confirm whether the shipment invoice will indicate 0% or 15% VAT. So far, they have provided only the advanced payment invoice, which cannot be used for shipment clearance, we also require detailed information about the items, including their description, HS codes and country of origin, to consult ZATCA and SASO for further clarification.

Regards,,

 

AHMAD HUSSEIN​​​​

‑

احمد حسين

DIRECTOR ‑ PRODUCT COMPLIANCE

George Akkawi <george.akkawi@swisslog.com <mailto:george.akkawi@swisslog.com> >
Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/-

 

Hi Shaik & Zaher,

 

Greetings from Swisslog.

 

Please find below the explanation from our finance team :

 

1.	Project attributable to the Permanent Establishment (PE) in KSA of SwissLog Middle East LLC

 

*       The PE Swisslog Middle East LLC in KSA is registered for VAT purposes as it probes the attached VAT certificate.

*       This project is attributable to the PE of this entity in KSA as the entity is established in KSA and there is a “force of attraction” for VAT purposes in KSA as this PE is the responsible one in executing this project.   

*       Therefore, the transaction is subject to VAT in KSA and Swisslog Middle East LLC ‘s PE should be obliged to charge 15 % VAT on the transactions.  

*       The above-mentioned VAT treatment would not be affected by the fact that the KSA customer is an entity established at the ILBZ Free zone as If a mainland entity sells capital goods to an entity in the ILBZ, the usual VAT rules will apply to such transactions as the special tax regime applicable to transactions carried out by entities established in the ILBZ is not applicable.

 

2.	Application of an Alternative scenario

 

*       In case, if the project has to be invoiced from the entity’s UAE tax ID number.  

*       as the project is attributable to its PE in KSA, Swisslog Middle East LLC should not be in position to use its UAE tax registration for invoicing the project.

chunks.text:
*       as the project is attributable to its PE in KSA, Swisslog Middle East LLC should not be in position to use its UAE tax registration for invoicing the project.

*       As a result of it, in the hypothetical case that the entity raised tax invoices from its UAE tax ID, the KSA VAT Authorities could consider that because of the force of attraction rule, the transactions of these projects should be subject to VAT in the KSA.

*       In addition, the KSA tax authorities could consider that any income arising from this project would be subject for direct tax purposes in KSA and 5% withholding tax should be applicable to any technical services component derived from this project.   

 

3.	Conclusions and way forward

 

The main conclusion is that as the project is attributable to SwissLog Middle East LLC PE in KSA, the tax invoice already raised by the entity to its KSA customer established in the ILBZ  where 15% KSA VAT has been applicable is correct from a KSA VAT standpoint.  

 

I believe this explains the situation but if you still have any questions, we can arrange the call with our tax expert when he is back next week. Please let us know your availability.

 

Best Regards,

Sourabh Shaha

Sales Manager – Middle East

Dear Rami and Sourabh, 

 

Thank you for submitting your Proposal for the warehouse automation project. We received several compelling offers, and we genuinely appreciate the effort and the time you have invested in your proposal. 

I am writing to officially announce that your company has been awarded the tender for this project. We evaluated all proposals according to the selection criteria outlined in the tender document. Your submission matched the requirements, and we were impressed by the quality of your proposal. 

We look forward to working with your team in delivering this project. We recognize the importance of developing a strong partnership with our suppliers, and we are confident that we can cooperate in achieving a successful outcome. 

 

About next steps. 

 

*         Please fill and sign the attached LOI .

 

*         We will initiate the PO issuance process.  

 

*         For the contract: we would need to engage in a formal agreement. If you have a contract template, please provide a copy for our Legal review.

 

My colleague @Reuben Thomas <mailto:Reuben.Thomas@chalhoub.com>  will support in the legal discussions .

 

And Once again, thank you for your interest in our project and for providing a compelling proposal.

The spare parts package on site ensures the downtime is kept the lowest and provides increased system availability.

Where “Taxes” means all forms of taxation and statutory and governmental, state, provincial, local governmental or municipal charges, duties, contributions, levies, withholdings and deductions, whether direct or indirect, and whether levied by reference to income, profits, gains, net wealth, asset values, turnover, added value or other reference, and statutory, governmental, state, local governmental or municipal impositions, duties, contributions, rates and levies or fees payable to any authority (including a tax authority), and value added tax or any other sales taxes, whenever and wherever charged and/or imposed (whether imposed by way of a withholding or deduction for or on account of tax or otherwise) and in respect of any person, and all penalties, charges, costs and interest relating thereto; 

 

Each party shall be responsible for its own tax obligations and liabilities arising from the execution of this agreement. The parties shall take all necessary steps to comply with local tax laws, including the filing of tax returns and payment of taxes. Each Party shall bear all taxes imposed on it by law in connection with this Agreement. 

 

In the event that local tax regulations require the withholding of taxes on payments made under this agreement, the paying party shall withhold the required amount and remit it to the relevant tax authorities.

Dear Mariel,

 

Would the following clause be sufficient?

 

All amounts payable under this Contract, including Contract Price, are exclusive of any applicable Taxes. Each Party shall be responsible for its own applicable Taxes and similar charges (including any related interest and penalties) as per the relevant tax laws and regulations. For the purpose of this clause, "Taxes" means all forms of taxation (including Zakat) and statutory and governmental, state, provincial, local governmental or municipal charges, duties, contributions, levies, withholdings and deductions, whether direct or indirect and whether levied by reference to income, profits, gains, net wealth, asset values, turnover, added value or other reference, and statutory, governmental, state, provincial, local governmental or municipal impositions, duties, contributions, rates and levies (including social security contributions and any other payroll taxes) or fees payable to any authority (including the Zakat, Tax and Customs Authority of the KSA), and value added tax or any other sales taxes, whenever and wherever charged and/or imposed (whether imposed by way of a withholding or deduction for or on account of tax or otherwise) and in respect of any person, and all penalties, charges, costs and interest relating thereto.

 

For reference, the T&C defines the "Contract Price" as "the total amount to be paid by the Purchaser for the Works, excluding value added tax and all other taxes or duties levied in the country where the Site is located".

Dear Sonia and team,

 

Are these all the documents? There are some major discrepancies and inconsistencies. Few comments from my side as a result of a high level review:

 

*	Amount different from USD 4.440K
*	General conditions do not align with the Orgalime contract draft (for example payment, late payment terms, Securities, Compensation, termination fees and lots more). It seems that the General Conditions document is a generic document and has not been modified to fit the purpose of this deal.
*	I have added some comments to the Orgalime contract (word document).
*	There are some key terms missing including (but not limited to) invoicing, shipping, good vs services, payment links (to invoicing or to shipping/provision of services), payment location (UAE/KSA).
*	Tax clauses are missing.

 

I suggest thorough review of these documents as well as having one contract/agreement properly drafted (and reviewed by tax) addressing all key aspects of this deal to ensure we are properly protected. Overall, the current drafts are inadequate, and it is strongly recommended that they are re-drafted/amended to fit the purpose.

 

Kind regards,

abe <Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com <mailto:Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com> >
Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Dear All,

 

I have had few discussions with AlTayer head of indirect tax (Jesus) and clarified the process. Here is a summary. Let me know if any questions:

 

*	Swisslog PE in KSA has neither a Commercial Registration nor an Import license in KSA. Therefore, the import clearance formalities of the equipment are carried out by their customers in KSA. This is the practice adopted for all the projects carried out by the PE in the KSA .

 

*	For the imports of goods, Swisslog will be issuing a Customs invoice from the UAE. This invoice will be used to clear the goods. No VAT / Customs implications should arise - Paragraph 4.3 of the ZATCA Resolution regarding ILBZ tax regime, SILZ is an area with a suspension status of customs duties and restrictions. Consequently, goods entering the zone are subject to special customs controls and procedures. The suspension of Customs duties payment extends to VAT in accordance with the VAT provisions and legislation in force (subject to ZATCA’s response to our ruling).  This would imply that goods of foreign origin from outside KSA may enter the zone without being subject to customs duties, VAT and restrictions if they are related to the activities licensed to be practiced in the zone.

 

*	When the project milestones are achieved, a Tax Invoice will be raised from the KSA PE with VAT at 15%.

 

*	The down payment invoice (which will be a Tax invoice with VAT) will be set off against milestones invoices and not import invoices.

I hope this clarifies the matter. If any questions / concerns let me know.

 

Kind regards,

abe <Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com <mailto:Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com> >
Subject: Re: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Hello,

Both SASO and ZATCA have yet to provide clear instructions on how these imports can be cleared, especially since CR issued by GACA does not authorize us to open an account with ZATCA or SABER, besides, we need a confirmation on whether items intended for warehouse operations are exempt from VAT, customs duties, and SASO requirements or not, following our last meeting with GACA, they clarified that VAT and customs exemptions for operational imports can only be requested after obtaining the completion certificate for the construction phase, maybe SILZ can provide a definitive answer to this matter.

Swisslog must confirm whether the shipment invoice will indicate 0% or 15% VAT. So far, they have provided only the advanced payment invoice, which cannot be used for shipment clearance, we also require detailed information about the items, including their description, HS codes and country of origin, to consult ZATCA and SASO for further clarification.

Regards,,

 

AHMAD HUSSEIN​​​​

‑

احمد حسين

chunks.text:
George Akkawi <george.akkawi@swisslog.com <mailto:george.akkawi@swisslog.com> >
Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/-

 

Hi Shaik & Zaher,

 

Greetings from Swisslog.

 

Please find below the explanation from our finance team :

 

1.	Project attributable to the Permanent Establishment (PE) in KSA of SwissLog Middle East LLC

 

*       The PE Swisslog Middle East LLC in KSA is registered for VAT purposes as it probes the attached VAT certificate.

*       This project is attributable to the PE of this entity in KSA as the entity is established in KSA and there is a “force of attraction” for VAT purposes in KSA as this PE is the responsible one in executing this project.   

*       Therefore, the transaction is subject to VAT in KSA and Swisslog Middle East LLC ‘s PE should be obliged to charge 15 % VAT on the transactions.  

*       The above-mentioned VAT treatment would not be affected by the fact that the KSA customer is an entity established at the ILBZ Free zone as If a mainland entity sells capital goods to an entity in the ILBZ, the usual VAT rules will apply to such transactions as the special tax regime applicable to transactions carried out by entities established in the ILBZ is not applicable.

 

2.	Application of an Alternative scenario

 

*       In case, if the project has to be invoiced from the entity’s UAE tax ID number.  

*       as the project is attributable to its PE in KSA, Swisslog Middle East LLC should not be in position to use its UAE tax registration for invoicing the project.

*       as the project is attributable to its PE in KSA, Swisslog Middle East LLC should not be in position to use its UAE tax registration for invoicing the project.

*       As a result of it, in the hypothetical case that the entity raised tax invoices from its UAE tax ID, the KSA VAT Authorities could consider that because of the force of attraction rule, the transactions of these projects should be subject to VAT in the KSA.

*       In addition, the KSA tax authorities could consider that any income arising from this project would be subject for direct tax purposes in KSA and 5% withholding tax should be applicable to any technical services component derived from this project.   

 

3.	Conclusions and way forward

 

The main conclusion is that as the project is attributable to SwissLog Middle East LLC PE in KSA, the tax invoice already raised by the entity to its KSA customer established in the ILBZ  where 15% KSA VAT has been applicable is correct from a KSA VAT standpoint.  

 

I believe this explains the situation but if you still have any questions, we can arrange the call with our tax expert when he is back next week. Please let us know your availability.

 

Best Regards,

Sourabh Shaha

Sales Manager – Middle East

warranty is provided against manufacturing defect or poor workmanship as per Orgalime contract. It does not cover the misuse of the system or accidents caused due to the client’s usage.

 

2.	Kindly confirm that during the warranty period, any spares used for fixing the issues by Swisslog needs to be replenished free of cost or replaced in case is used from our stock. Please define the replenishment SLA. During warranty period, any spares used by Swisslog will be replenished Free of cost. The spare parts package on site ensures the downtime is kept the lowest and provides increased system availability.

 

 

3.	Pick Stations – Pick to Light & Put to Light should be an integrated solution as the Pick Stations need to be configurable between Mono-Order-Picking and Multi-Order-Picking . kindly add the cost of put to light for the 8 Outbound stations .

Our assumption is that pick to light is already part of your scope , please confirm whether put to light stands along with light and controllers are included in your offer if not please share the cost.

Please refer the attached updated offer for :

*       Pick by light (Pointer) for 8 workstations

*       Pick/put to light systems for 8 picking workstations (The manual trolleys to be provided by Chalhoub)

      

      These were shown as optional value-added features in all our earlier offers and presentations.

 

4.	Cockpit – We need to have the Analytics Cockpit as part of the offer for visibility of operational stats real time for better managing the operations. kindly share the cost. Added the offer for Cockpit in the attached document.

5.	Infrastructure & Devices – We need a confirmation of the list of peripheral devices and tech infrastructure required to be provided by Chalhoub team so our internal team can review and sign-off. Please provide the list of the IT required items: please refer the attached presentation “SynQ AS solution IT peripherals”.

 

 

6.	Testing & UAT – We will need a separate instance for integration testing & UAT, other than production environment along with a simulator to replicate the behavior of the Decanting & Picking activities for testing. kindly confirm it is part of the scope.

We will provide a test and live environments. Testing can be performed in test environment, and it can be moved to live once the testing is satisfactory.

We have included ramp up support after Taking Over (1 week on-site and 2 weeks remote support)

 

7.	Kindly add the fire cladding to the scope for protection between perfumes or dangerous goods from other SKUS . We have added the cladding to separate both areas with our fire-resistant (Fire behavior: minimum C-s3, d0 according to EN 13501-1) PVC sheet.

Dear Sonia,

 

First of all, thanks for giving us the opportunity to participate in this project. We are keen and excited to work on this project.

 

Per our last meeting, we went back and recalibrated our numbers and attached is the revised offer for your kind review.

 

Please note that we have added a full set of critical spares recommended by Autostore (attached the list) in the CAPEX which includes shipping as well (CFR delivery).

We have worked hard to reach to this level and are looking to get your order acceptance now.

Dear Sayed,

 

I would suggest the following amended wording:

 

Where “Taxes” means all forms of taxation and statutory and governmental, state, provincial, local governmental or municipal charges, duties, contributions, levies, withholdings and deductions, whether direct or indirect, and whether levied by reference to income, profits, gains, net wealth, asset values, turnover, added value or other reference, and statutory, governmental, state, local governmental or municipal impositions, duties, contributions, rates and levies or fees payable to any authority (including a tax authority), and value added tax or any other sales taxes, whenever and wherever charged and/or imposed (whether imposed by way of a withholding or deduction for or on account of tax or otherwise) and in respect of any person, and all penalties, charges, costs and interest relating thereto; 

 

Each party shall be responsible for its own tax obligations and liabilities arising from the execution of this agreement. The parties shall take all necessary steps to comply with local tax laws, including the filing of tax returns and payment of taxes. Each Party shall bear all taxes imposed on it by law in connection with this Agreement. 

 

In the event that local tax regulations require the withholding of taxes on payments made under this agreement, the paying party shall withhold the required amount and remit it to the relevant tax authorities.

Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Dear Mariel,

 

Would the following clause be sufficient?

 

All amounts payable under this Contract, including Contract Price, are exclusive of any applicable Taxes. Each Party shall be responsible for its own applicable Taxes and similar charges (including any related interest and penalties) as per the relevant tax laws and regulations. For the purpose of this clause, "Taxes" means all forms of taxation (including Zakat) and statutory and governmental, state, provincial, local governmental or municipal charges, duties, contributions, levies, withholdings and deductions, whether direct or indirect and whether levied by reference to income, profits, gains, net wealth, asset values, turnover, added value or other reference, and statutory, governmental, state, provincial, local governmental or municipal impositions, duties, contributions, rates and levies (including social security contributions and any other payroll taxes) or fees payable to any authority (including the Zakat, Tax and Customs Authority of the KSA), and value added tax or any other sales taxes, whenever and wherever charged and/or imposed (whether imposed by way of a withholding or deduction for or on account of tax or otherwise) and in respect of any person, and all penalties, charges, costs and interest relating thereto.

 

For reference, the T&C defines the "Contract Price" as "the total amount to be paid by the Purchaser for the Works, excluding value added tax and all other taxes or duties levied in the country where the Site is located".

Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Dear Sonia and team,

 

Are these all the documents? There are some major discrepancies and inconsistencies. Few comments from my side as a result of a high level review:

 

*	Amount different from USD 4.440K
*	General conditions do not align with the Orgalime contract draft (for example payment, late payment terms, Securities, Compensation, termination fees and lots more). It seems that the General Conditions document is a generic document and has not been modified to fit the purpose of this deal.
*	I have added some comments to the Orgalime contract (word document).
*	There are some key terms missing including (but not limited to) invoicing, shipping, good vs services, payment links (to invoicing or to shipping/provision of services), payment location (UAE/KSA).
*	Tax clauses are missing.

 

I suggest thorough review of these documents as well as having one contract/agreement properly drafted (and reviewed by tax) addressing all key aspects of this deal to ensure we are properly protected. Overall, the current drafts are inadequate, and it is strongly recommended that they are re-drafted/amended to fit the purpose.

 

Kind regards,

abe <Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com <mailto:Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com> >
Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Dear All,

 

I have had few discussions with AlTayer head of indirect tax (Jesus) and clarified the process. Here is a summary. Let me know if any questions:

 

*	Swisslog PE in KSA has neither a Commercial Registration nor an Import license in KSA. Therefore, the import clearance formalities of the equipment are carried out by their customers in KSA. This is the practice adopted for all the projects carried out by the PE in the KSA .

 

*	For the imports of goods, Swisslog will be issuing a Customs invoice from the UAE. This invoice will be used to clear the goods. No VAT / Customs implications should arise - Paragraph 4.3 of the ZATCA Resolution regarding ILBZ tax regime, SILZ is an area with a suspension status of customs duties and restrictions. Consequently, goods entering the zone are subject to special customs controls and procedures. The suspension of Customs duties payment extends to VAT in accordance with the VAT provisions and legislation in force (subject to ZATCA’s response to our ruling).  This would imply that goods of foreign origin from outside KSA may enter the zone without being subject to customs duties, VAT and restrictions if they are related to the activities licensed to be practiced in the zone.

 

*	When the project milestones are achieved, a Tax Invoice will be raised from the KSA PE with VAT at 15%.

 

*	The down payment invoice (which will be a Tax invoice with VAT) will be set off against milestones invoices and not import invoices.

abe <Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com <mailto:Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com> >
Subject: Re: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Hello,

Both SASO and ZATCA have yet to provide clear instructions on how these imports can be cleared, especially since CR issued by GACA does not authorize us to open an account with ZATCA or SABER, besides, we need a confirmation on whether items intended for warehouse operations are exempt from VAT, customs duties, and SASO requirements or not, following our last meeting with GACA, they clarified that VAT and customs exemptions for operational imports can only be requested after obtaining the completion certificate for the construction phase, maybe SILZ can provide a definitive answer to this matter.

Swisslog must confirm whether the shipment invoice will indicate 0% or 15% VAT. So far, they have provided only the advanced payment invoice, which cannot be used for shipment clearance, we also require detailed information about the items, including their description, HS codes and country of origin, to consult ZATCA and SASO for further clarification.

Regards,,

 

AHMAD HUSSEIN​​​​

‑

احمد حسين

DIRECTOR ‑ PRODUCT COMPLIANCE

CHALHOUB GROUP ARABIA LIMITED COMPANY LLC

RIYADH

‑

SAUDI ARABIA

George Akkawi <george.akkawi@swisslog.com <mailto:george.akkawi@swisslog.com> >
Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/-

 

Hi Shaik & Zaher,

 

Greetings from Swisslog.

 

Please find below the explanation from our finance team :

 

1.	Project attributable to the Permanent Establishment (PE) in KSA of SwissLog Middle East LLC

 

*       The PE Swisslog Middle East LLC in KSA is registered for VAT purposes as it probes the attached VAT certificate.

*       This project is attributable to the PE of this entity in KSA as the entity is established in KSA and there is a “force of attraction” for VAT purposes in KSA as this PE is the responsible one in executing this project.   

*       Therefore, the transaction is subject to VAT in KSA and Swisslog Middle East LLC ‘s PE should be obliged to charge 15 % VAT on the transactions.  

*       The above-mentioned VAT treatment would not be affected by the fact that the KSA customer is an entity established at the ILBZ Free zone as If a mainland entity sells capital goods to an entity in the ILBZ, the usual VAT rules will apply to such transactions as the special tax regime applicable to transactions carried out by entities established in the ILBZ is not applicable.

 

2.	Application of an Alternative scenario

 

*       In case, if the project has to be invoiced from the entity’s UAE tax ID number.  

*       as the project is attributable to its PE in KSA, Swisslog Middle East LLC should not be in position to use its UAE tax registration for invoicing the project.

chunks.text:
*       as the project is attributable to its PE in KSA, Swisslog Middle East LLC should not be in position to use its UAE tax registration for invoicing the project.

*       As a result of it, in the hypothetical case that the entity raised tax invoices from its UAE tax ID, the KSA VAT Authorities could consider that because of the force of attraction rule, the transactions of these projects should be subject to VAT in the KSA.

*       In addition, the KSA tax authorities could consider that any income arising from this project would be subject for direct tax purposes in KSA and 5% withholding tax should be applicable to any technical services component derived from this project.   

 

3.	Conclusions and way forward

 

The main conclusion is that as the project is attributable to SwissLog Middle East LLC PE in KSA, the tax invoice already raised by the entity to its KSA customer established in the ILBZ  where 15% KSA VAT has been applicable is correct from a KSA VAT standpoint.  

 

I believe this explains the situation but if you still have any questions, we can arrange the call with our tax expert when he is back next week. Please let us know your availability.

 

Best Regards,

Sourabh Shaha

Sales Manager – Middle East

warranty is provided against manufacturing defect or poor workmanship as per Orgalime contract. It does not cover the misuse of the system or accidents caused due to the client’s usage.

 

2.	Kindly confirm that during the warranty period, any spares used for fixing the issues by Swisslog needs to be replenished free of cost or replaced in case is used from our stock. Please define the replenishment SLA. During warranty period, any spares used by Swisslog will be replenished Free of cost. The spare parts package on site ensures the downtime is kept the lowest and provides increased system availability.

 

 

3.	Pick Stations – Pick to Light & Put to Light should be an integrated solution as the Pick Stations need to be configurable between Mono-Order-Picking and Multi-Order-Picking . kindly add the cost of put to light for the 8 Outbound stations .

Our assumption is that pick to light is already part of your scope , please confirm whether put to light stands along with light and controllers are included in your offer if not please share the cost.

Please refer the attached updated offer for :

*       Pick by light (Pointer) for 8 workstations

*       Pick/put to light systems for 8 picking workstations (The manual trolleys to be provided by Chalhoub)

      

      These were shown as optional value-added features in all our earlier offers and presentations.

 

4.	Cockpit – We need to have the Analytics Cockpit as part of the offer for visibility of operational stats real time for better managing the operations. kindly share the cost. Added the offer for Cockpit in the attached document.

We will provide a test and live environments. Testing can be performed in test environment, and it can be moved to live once the testing is satisfactory.

Dear Sonia,

 

First of all, thanks for giving us the opportunity to participate in this project. We are keen and excited to work on this project.

 

Per our last meeting, we went back and recalibrated our numbers and attached is the revised offer for your kind review.

 

Please note that we have added a full set of critical spares recommended by Autostore (attached the list) in the CAPEX which includes shipping as well (CFR delivery).

 

Another slide where you can find our reworked numbers for AMC & 24*7 support.

 

We have worked hard to reach to this level and are looking to get your order acceptance now.

 

Please note that the prices quoted have a very short validity that means we must get the order in November itself (as further delay will increase the prices not just from Swisslog but from Autostore too).

 

We are ready and available to support you to close this project as soon as possible.

 

Looking forward to your feedback.

 

Best Regards,

 

Sourabh Shaha

Sales Manager - Middle East

Dear Sayed,

 

I would suggest the following amended wording:

 

Where “Taxes” means all forms of taxation and statutory and governmental, state, provincial, local governmental or municipal charges, duties, contributions, levies, withholdings and deductions, whether direct or indirect, and whether levied by reference to income, profits, gains, net wealth, asset values, turnover, added value or other reference, and statutory, governmental, state, local governmental or municipal impositions, duties, contributions, rates and levies or fees payable to any authority (including a tax authority), and value added tax or any other sales taxes, whenever and wherever charged and/or imposed (whether imposed by way of a withholding or deduction for or on account of tax or otherwise) and in respect of any person, and all penalties, charges, costs and interest relating thereto; 

 

Each party shall be responsible for its own tax obligations and liabilities arising from the execution of this agreement. The parties shall take all necessary steps to comply with local tax laws, including the filing of tax returns and payment of taxes. Each Party shall bear all taxes imposed on it by law in connection with this Agreement. 

 

In the event that local tax regulations require the withholding of taxes on payments made under this agreement, the paying party shall withhold the required amount and remit it to the relevant tax authorities.

Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Dear Mariel,

 

Would the following clause be sufficient?

 

All amounts payable under this Contract, including Contract Price, are exclusive of any applicable Taxes. Each Party shall be responsible for its own applicable Taxes and similar charges (including any related interest and penalties) as per the relevant tax laws and regulations. For the purpose of this clause, "Taxes" means all forms of taxation (including Zakat) and statutory and governmental, state, provincial, local governmental or municipal charges, duties, contributions, levies, withholdings and deductions, whether direct or indirect and whether levied by reference to income, profits, gains, net wealth, asset values, turnover, added value or other reference, and statutory, governmental, state, provincial, local governmental or municipal impositions, duties, contributions, rates and levies (including social security contributions and any other payroll taxes) or fees payable to any authority (including the Zakat, Tax and Customs Authority of the KSA), and value added tax or any other sales taxes, whenever and wherever charged and/or imposed (whether imposed by way of a withholding or deduction for or on account of tax or otherwise) and in respect of any person, and all penalties, charges, costs and interest relating thereto.

 

For reference, the T&C defines the "Contract Price" as "the total amount to be paid by the Purchaser for the Works, excluding value added tax and all other taxes or duties levied in the country where the Site is located".

Dear Sonia and team,

 

Are these all the documents? There are some major discrepancies and inconsistencies. Few comments from my side as a result of a high level review:

 

*	Amount different from USD 4.440K
*	General conditions do not align with the Orgalime contract draft (for example payment, late payment terms, Securities, Compensation, termination fees and lots more). It seems that the General Conditions document is a generic document and has not been modified to fit the purpose of this deal.
*	I have added some comments to the Orgalime contract (word document).
*	There are some key terms missing including (but not limited to) invoicing, shipping, good vs services, payment links (to invoicing or to shipping/provision of services), payment location (UAE/KSA).
*	Tax clauses are missing.

 

I suggest thorough review of these documents as well as having one contract/agreement properly drafted (and reviewed by tax) addressing all key aspects of this deal to ensure we are properly protected. Overall, the current drafts are inadequate, and it is strongly recommended that they are re-drafted/amended to fit the purpose.

 

Kind regards,

abe <Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com <mailto:Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com> >
Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Dear All,

 

I have had few discussions with AlTayer head of indirect tax (Jesus) and clarified the process. Here is a summary. Let me know if any questions:

 

*	Swisslog PE in KSA has neither a Commercial Registration nor an Import license in KSA. Therefore, the import clearance formalities of the equipment are carried out by their customers in KSA. This is the practice adopted for all the projects carried out by the PE in the KSA .

 

*	For the imports of goods, Swisslog will be issuing a Customs invoice from the UAE. This invoice will be used to clear the goods. No VAT / Customs implications should arise - Paragraph 4.3 of the ZATCA Resolution regarding ILBZ tax regime, SILZ is an area with a suspension status of customs duties and restrictions. Consequently, goods entering the zone are subject to special customs controls and procedures. The suspension of Customs duties payment extends to VAT in accordance with the VAT provisions and legislation in force (subject to ZATCA’s response to our ruling).  This would imply that goods of foreign origin from outside KSA may enter the zone without being subject to customs duties, VAT and restrictions if they are related to the activities licensed to be practiced in the zone.

 

*	When the project milestones are achieved, a Tax Invoice will be raised from the KSA PE with VAT at 15%.

 

*	The down payment invoice (which will be a Tax invoice with VAT) will be set off against milestones invoices and not import invoices.

I hope this clarifies the matter. If any questions / concerns let me know.

 

Kind regards,

abe <Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com <mailto:Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com> >
Subject: Re: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Hello,

Both SASO and ZATCA have yet to provide clear instructions on how these imports can be cleared, especially since CR issued by GACA does not authorize us to open an account with ZATCA or SABER, besides, we need a confirmation on whether items intended for warehouse operations are exempt from VAT, customs duties, and SASO requirements or not, following our last meeting with GACA, they clarified that VAT and customs exemptions for operational imports can only be requested after obtaining the completion certificate for the construction phase, maybe SILZ can provide a definitive answer to this matter.

Swisslog must confirm whether the shipment invoice will indicate 0% or 15% VAT. So far, they have provided only the advanced payment invoice, which cannot be used for shipment clearance, we also require detailed information about the items, including their description, HS codes and country of origin, to consult ZATCA and SASO for further clarification.

Regards,,

 

AHMAD HUSSEIN​​​​

‑

احمد حسين

chunks.text:
George Akkawi <george.akkawi@swisslog.com <mailto:george.akkawi@swisslog.com> >
Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/-

 

Hi Shaik & Zaher,

 

Greetings from Swisslog.

 

Please find below the explanation from our finance team :

 

1.	Project attributable to the Permanent Establishment (PE) in KSA of SwissLog Middle East LLC

 

*       The PE Swisslog Middle East LLC in KSA is registered for VAT purposes as it probes the attached VAT certificate.

*       This project is attributable to the PE of this entity in KSA as the entity is established in KSA and there is a “force of attraction” for VAT purposes in KSA as this PE is the responsible one in executing this project.   

*       Therefore, the transaction is subject to VAT in KSA and Swisslog Middle East LLC ‘s PE should be obliged to charge 15 % VAT on the transactions.  

*       The above-mentioned VAT treatment would not be affected by the fact that the KSA customer is an entity established at the ILBZ Free zone as If a mainland entity sells capital goods to an entity in the ILBZ, the usual VAT rules will apply to such transactions as the special tax regime applicable to transactions carried out by entities established in the ILBZ is not applicable.

 

2.	Application of an Alternative scenario

 

*       In case, if the project has to be invoiced from the entity’s UAE tax ID number.  

*       as the project is attributable to its PE in KSA, Swisslog Middle East LLC should not be in position to use its UAE tax registration for invoicing the project.

*       as the project is attributable to its PE in KSA, Swisslog Middle East LLC should not be in position to use its UAE tax registration for invoicing the project.

*       As a result of it, in the hypothetical case that the entity raised tax invoices from its UAE tax ID, the KSA VAT Authorities could consider that because of the force of attraction rule, the transactions of these projects should be subject to VAT in the KSA.

*       In addition, the KSA tax authorities could consider that any income arising from this project would be subject for direct tax purposes in KSA and 5% withholding tax should be applicable to any technical services component derived from this project.   

 

3.	Conclusions and way forward

 

The main conclusion is that as the project is attributable to SwissLog Middle East LLC PE in KSA, the tax invoice already raised by the entity to its KSA customer established in the ILBZ  where 15% KSA VAT has been applicable is correct from a KSA VAT standpoint.  

 

I believe this explains the situation but if you still have any questions, we can arrange the call with our tax expert when he is back next week. Please let us know your availability.

 

Best Regards,

Sourabh Shaha

Sales Manager – Middle East

warranty is provided against manufacturing defect or poor workmanship as per Orgalime contract. It does not cover the misuse of the system or accidents caused due to the client’s usage.

 

2.	Kindly confirm that during the warranty period, any spares used for fixing the issues by Swisslog needs to be replenished free of cost or replaced in case is used from our stock. Please define the replenishment SLA. During warranty period, any spares used by Swisslog will be replenished Free of cost. The spare parts package on site ensures the downtime is kept the lowest and provides increased system availability.

 

 

3.	Pick Stations – Pick to Light & Put to Light should be an integrated solution as the Pick Stations need to be configurable between Mono-Order-Picking and Multi-Order-Picking . kindly add the cost of put to light for the 8 Outbound stations .

Our assumption is that pick to light is already part of your scope , please confirm whether put to light stands along with light and controllers are included in your offer if not please share the cost.

Please refer the attached updated offer for :

*       Pick by light (Pointer) for 8 workstations

*       Pick/put to light systems for 8 picking workstations (The manual trolleys to be provided by Chalhoub)

      

      These were shown as optional value-added features in all our earlier offers and presentations.

 

4.	Cockpit – We need to have the Analytics Cockpit as part of the offer for visibility of operational stats real time for better managing the operations. kindly share the cost. Added the offer for Cockpit in the attached document.

5.	Infrastructure & Devices – We need a confirmation of the list of peripheral devices and tech infrastructure required to be provided by Chalhoub team so our internal team can review and sign-off. Please provide the list of the IT required items: please refer the attached presentation “SynQ AS solution IT peripherals”.

 

 

6.	Testing & UAT – We will need a separate instance for integration testing & UAT, other than production environment along with a simulator to replicate the behavior of the Decanting & Picking activities for testing. kindly confirm it is part of the scope.

We will provide a test and live environments. Testing can be performed in test environment, and it can be moved to live once the testing is satisfactory.

We have included ramp up support after Taking Over (1 week on-site and 2 weeks remote support)

 

7.	Kindly add the fire cladding to the scope for protection between perfumes or dangerous goods from other SKUS . We have added the cladding to separate both areas with our fire-resistant (Fire behavior: minimum C-s3, d0 according to EN 13501-1) PVC sheet.

Dear Sonia,

 

First of all, thanks for giving us the opportunity to participate in this project. We are keen and excited to work on this project.

 

Per our last meeting, we went back and recalibrated our numbers and attached is the revised offer for your kind review.

 

Please note that we have added a full set of critical spares recommended by Autostore (attached the list) in the CAPEX which includes shipping as well (CFR delivery).

 

Another slide where you can find our reworked numbers for AMC & 24*7 support.

 

We have worked hard to reach to this level and are looking to get your order acceptance now.

 

Please note that the prices quoted have a very short validity that means we must get the order in November itself (as further delay will increase the prices not just from Swisslog but from Autostore too).

Looking forward to your feedback.

Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Dear Sayed,

 

I would suggest the following amended wording:

 

Where “Taxes” means all forms of taxation and statutory and governmental, state, provincial, local governmental or municipal charges, duties, contributions, levies, withholdings and deductions, whether direct or indirect, and whether levied by reference to income, profits, gains, net wealth, asset values, turnover, added value or other reference, and statutory, governmental, state, local governmental or municipal impositions, duties, contributions, rates and levies or fees payable to any authority (including a tax authority), and value added tax or any other sales taxes, whenever and wherever charged and/or imposed (whether imposed by way of a withholding or deduction for or on account of tax or otherwise) and in respect of any person, and all penalties, charges, costs and interest relating thereto; 

 

Each party shall be responsible for its own tax obligations and liabilities arising from the execution of this agreement. The parties shall take all necessary steps to comply with local tax laws, including the filing of tax returns and payment of taxes. Each Party shall bear all taxes imposed on it by law in connection with this Agreement. 

 

In the event that local tax regulations require the withholding of taxes on payments made under this agreement, the paying party shall withhold the required amount and remit it to the relevant tax authorities.

Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Dear Mariel,

 

Would the following clause be sufficient?

 

All amounts payable under this Contract, including Contract Price, are exclusive of any applicable Taxes. Each Party shall be responsible for its own applicable Taxes and similar charges (including any related interest and penalties) as per the relevant tax laws and regulations. For the purpose of this clause, "Taxes" means all forms of taxation (including Zakat) and statutory and governmental, state, provincial, local governmental or municipal charges, duties, contributions, levies, withholdings and deductions, whether direct or indirect and whether levied by reference to income, profits, gains, net wealth, asset values, turnover, added value or other reference, and statutory, governmental, state, provincial, local governmental or municipal impositions, duties, contributions, rates and levies (including social security contributions and any other payroll taxes) or fees payable to any authority (including the Zakat, Tax and Customs Authority of the KSA), and value added tax or any other sales taxes, whenever and wherever charged and/or imposed (whether imposed by way of a withholding or deduction for or on account of tax or otherwise) and in respect of any person, and all penalties, charges, costs and interest relating thereto.

 

For reference, the T&C defines the "Contract Price" as "the total amount to be paid by the Purchaser for the Works, excluding value added tax and all other taxes or duties levied in the country where the Site is located".

abe <Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com <mailto:Eric.Bernabe@3d-consultants.com> >
Subject: RE: PO 3261000002 -Swisslog- Automation system for CAS Fulfilment Hub-Al Tawreed Riyadh – USD 4,440,000.00/- 

 

Dear Sonia and team,

 

Are these all the documents? There are some major discrepancies and inconsistencies. Few comments from my side as a result of a high level review:

 

*	Amount different from USD 4.440K
*	General conditions do not align with the Orgalime contract draft (for example payment, late payment terms, Securities, Compensation, termination fees and lots more). It seems that the General Conditions document is a generic document and has not been modified to fit the purpose of this deal.
*	I have added some comments to the Orgalime contract (word document).
*	There are some key terms missing including (but not limited to) invoicing, shipping, good vs services, payment links (to invoicing or to shipping/provision of services), payment location (UAE/KSA).
*	Tax clauses are missing.

 

I suggest thorough review of these documents as well as having one contract/agreement properly drafted (and reviewed by tax) addressing all key aspects of this deal to ensure we are properly protected. Overall, the current drafts are inadequate, and it is strongly recommended that they are re-drafted/amended to fit the purpose.

 

Kind regards,
